message.content:
Euphorbia hyssopifolia is a species of herbaceous annual plant that belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae. 
It has a slender, upright stem that can reach up to 60 cm in height. 
The leaves are small, narrow, and linear in shape, about 1 cm long and 2 mm wide. 
The plant produces tiny greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered together in an inflorescence. 
They bloom in late spring or early summer. 
The texture of the plant is smooth, and it has a unique odor when crushed.  
Euphorbia hyssopifolia can be found in tropical or subtropical regions and is often used medicinally for treating skin conditions and other ailments.
